text: [[i]]Exposed to Elspeth’s deathly touch, magical munitions can be launched across the battlefield to horrifying effect.[[/i]]
[[i]]The Great Cannon is widely feared for the ease with which it rips apart flesh and armour alike, its simple engineering easily modified by the school’s designs to magnify its devastation.[[/i]]
[[i]]The Pistoliers and Outriders of the Empire are experts at harassing enemy flanks and evading harm, skills that are aided by the Gunnery School’s cavalry wing.[[/i]]

[[i]]With its rudimentary central crank and multiple barrels, the Helblaster is the somewhat unreliable invention of a deranged former professor at the school, now available with new improvements.[[/i]]

[[i]]The Empire’s favoured solution to having more projectiles-per-second fired from a piece of artillery is the Helstorm Rocket Battery, for which the Gunnery School’s modifications do little to complicate.[[/i]]

[[i]]Wielding a range of high-powered black powder weapons, the riflemen of the Empire are deadly at all ranges, and even deadlier when boosted by the Gunnery School’s standard-issue modifications.[[/i]]
[[i]]The original Marienburg Land Ship design was never too difficult to improve upon, with the Engineers School’s close study of the hulking War Machine offering useful areas of improvement.[[/i]]

[[i]]The Empire Mortars’ high firing arcs make them the most difficult to operate accurately, but with the Gunnery School’s developments, the artillery’s tactical advantage can be exponentially increased.[[/i]]
[[i]]The blueprints for the meticulously built Steam Tanks of the Empire are kept under lock and key in the Engineers School, including variations in the machine’s design and battle protocols.[[/i]]
